skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: This skill is a meta-skill providing guidance and utilities for creating other skills. After detailed evaluation, all 112 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the scanner misinterpreting: markdown code formatting (backticks) as shell execution, standard Apache license URLs as network indicators, and common English words as cryptographic algorithm references. The three Python scripts use only Python standard library modules (pathlib, zipfile, re, os, sys) and perform legitimate file operations for skill scaffolding, validation, and packaging. No actual network calls, command injection risks, or malicious patterns exist.

content.value_statement: Creating skills from scratch requires understanding structure, naming conventions, and bundled resources. This skill provides step-by-step guidance and Python utilities to scaffold, validate, and package skills for distribution.
actual_capabilities: Follows a 6-step process to create new skills from concrete examples
Uses init_skill.py to scaffold new skill directories with proper structure
Uses quick_validate.py to verify SKILL.md format and required fields
Uses package_skill.py to create distributable zip files
Organizes bundled resources: scripts/, references/, and assets/
Implements progressive disclosure design for efficient context management
limitations: Does not execute user code or access external APIs
Does not modify existing skills beyond validation feedback
Requires manual editing of SKILL.md for complete skill documentation
Scripts only operate on local skill folders, not remote repositories

use_cases.title: Build custom skill packages
use_cases.description: Package specialized workflows and tool integrations into distributable skills for your team.

use_cases.title: Create documentation skills
use_cases.description: Bundle company policies, API docs, and reference materials into skills Claude can use.

use_cases.title: Share domain knowledge
use_cases.description: Package domain expertise into skills that equip Claude with specialized knowledge.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called my-new-skill at skills/public that helps with data analysis tasks. Include guidance for loading and processing datasets.

prompt_templates.title: Package existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate and package the skills/pdf-editor skill located in skills/public for distribution to users.

prompt_templates.title: Add resources
prompt_templates.scenario: Add bundled resources to a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: What scripts, references, or assets would be most useful for a skill that generates PowerPoint presentations?

prompt_templates.title: Iterate on skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the skills/code-formatter skill and suggest three improvements based on the skill creation principles in this skill.

output_examples.input: Create a new skill called email-helper that helps draft and organize professional emails.
output: Created SKILL.md with template and guidance
Skill ready for customization. Next: Edit SKILL.md to complete TODO items.

output_examples.input: Validate and package my pdf-editor skill for distribution.
What resources should I include for a skill that processes DOCX documents?
output: Scripts: document.py for reading DOCX, utilities.py for common transformations
References: API documentation for python-docx library, formatting guide
Assets: Template documents, styles reference files, output examples

best_practices: Start with concrete examples of how the skill will be used before defining its structure
Use references/ for detailed documentation to keep SKILL.md lean and focused
Delete unused example files after initialization to keep skills minimal
anti_patterns: Avoid including everything in SKILL.md without using references files
Do not skip the validation step before packaging skills for distribution
Avoid overgeneralizing skills with too many unrelated capabilities

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance for creating skills that can be used by any of these tools.

faq.question: What are the naming requirements for skills?
faq.answer: Skill names must use hyphen-case (lowercase with hyphens), contain only letters, digits, and hyphens, and not start or end with a hyphen.

faq.question: Can I include external API integrations in my skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Include API documentation in references/ and helper scripts in scripts/. The skill creation skill focuses on structure, not specific integrations.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. These scripts only read and write to local skill directories. They make no network calls and access no environment variables.

faq.question: Why does validation fail on my SKILL.md?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing YAML frontmatter, missing name or description fields, invalid characters in description, or improper naming convention.

faq.question: How is this different from other template generators?
faq.answer: This skill follows Claude-specific conventions including progressive disclosure design, bundled resource organization, and structured workflow guidance.
